info.name: Content V2 API Test
info.description:
The Content Management APIs allow you to create, manage and process content on the Sunbird platform. Content is the basic building block of the Knowledge Service. Some examples would be Videos, Audio, Pdfs, Html, ECML etc. The basic operations for this API include Create, Update, Read, Review, Publish.

The URL for Content Management API(s) is /content/v1.

exec: pm.test("Verify keys and data type of the response result", () => {

This API is associated with batch creation
The endpoint for Creates a Batch is /batch/create
The fields marked with an asterisk (*) are mandatory. They cannot be null or empty.

request.description:
This API is associated with batch creation
The endpoint for Creates a Batch is /batch/create
The fields marked with an asterisk (*) are mandatory. They cannot be null or empty.

item.name: 200 - Get all data except external data

exec: pm.test("Verify keys and data type of the response result", () => {

request.description:
Fetch a particular Batch
This API is associated with fetching a particular batch on the Sunbird Platform.
The endpoint for Fetch a particular Batch is /batch/read/{Batch_ID}
The fields marked with an asterisk (*) are mandatory. They cannot be null or empty.

item.name: 200 - Get specific attributes by sending fields query params

exec: pm.test("Verify keys and data type of the response result", () => {

query.description: Fields param is used to get the external data in response, by default read API doesn't return external data. Also fields can be used to get the specific data only in response instead of getting all the data.

request.description:
Fetch a particular Batch
This API is associated with fetching a particular batch on the Sunbird Platform.
The endpoint for Fetch a particular Batch is /batch/read/{Batch_ID}
The fields marked with an asterisk (*) are mandatory. They cannot be null or empty.

item.name: 200 - Update existing data or add new data

exec: pm.test("Verify keys and data type of the response result", () => {
pm.test("identifier should be equal to " + pm.globals.get("content_id"), () => {
pm.test("node_id should be equal to " + pm.globals.get("content_id"), () => {

request.description:
This API is associated with updating a batch on the Sunbird Platform.
The endpoint for Course Batch Update is /batch/update
The fields marked with an asterisk (*) are mandatory. They cannot be null or empty.

exec: pm.test("Verify keys and data type of the response result", () => {
pm.test("identifier should be equal to " + pm.globals.get("content_id"), () => {
pm.test("node_id should be equal to " + pm.globals.get("content_id"), () => {

request.description:

The endpoint for Course Batch Update is /batch/update
The fields marked with an asterisk (*) are mandatory. They cannot be null or empty.

header.description: The Content Type entity is the media type of the resource.Possible media types can be application/json.
Represents the authorized User ID to execute the API.
To make use of the API, you require authorization. Raise a request to the administrator for the use of the API. You will receive the authorization key. Specify the key received, here.
Represents a physical location (e.g: state) uniquely to which the user belongs.

request.description:
This API is associated with creating content on the Sunbird Platform. Mandatory fields (name, code, mimeType and primaryCategory) cannot be null or empty.

The body refers to the format of the request.

*   The body contains metadata about the content to be updated.
*   Please refer for supported [metadata](https://github.com/project-sunbird/knowledge-platform/blob/master/schemas/content/1.0/schema.json)

pm.test("result body should include messages \"Metadata mimeType should be one of: [application/vnd.ekstep.ecml-archive, application/vnd.ekstep.html-archive, application/vnd.android.package-archive, application/vnd.ekstep.content-archive, application/vnd.ekstep.content-collection, application/vnd.ekstep.plugin-archive, application/vnd.ekstep.h5p-archive, application/epub, text/x-url, video/x-youtube, application/octet-stream, application/msword, application/pdf, image/jpeg, image/jpg, image/png, image/tiff, image/bmp, image/gif, image/svg+xml, video/avi, video/mpeg, video/quicktime, video/3gpp, video/mp4, video/ogg, video/webm, audio/mp3, audio/mp4, audio/mpeg, audio/ogg, audio/webm, audio/x-wav, audio/wav, application/json, application/quiz]\"", () => {

pm.expect(jsonResponse.result.messages).to.include('Metadata mimeType should be one of: [application/vnd.ekstep.ecml-archive, application/vnd.ekstep.html-archive, application/vnd.android.package-archive, application/vnd.ekstep.content-archive, application/vnd.ekstep.content-collection, application/vnd.ekstep.plugin-archive, application/vnd.ekstep.h5p-archive, application/epub, text/x-url, video/x-youtube, application/octet-stream, application/msword, application/pdf, image/jpeg, image/jpg, image/png, image/tiff, image/bmp, image/gif, image/svg+xml, video/avi, video/mpeg, video/quicktime, video/3gpp, video/mp4, video/ogg, video/webm, audio/mp3, audio/mp4, audio/mpeg, audio/ogg, audio/webm, audio/x-wav, audio/wav, application/json, application/quiz]');

header.description: The Content Type entity is the media type of the resource.Possible media types can be application/json.
Represents the authorized User ID to execute the API.
To make use of the API, you require authorization. Raise a request to the administrator for the use of the API. You will receive the authorization key. Specify the key received, here.
Represents a physical location (e.g: state) uniquely to which the user belongs.

request.description:
This API is associated with creating content on the Sunbird Platform. Mandatory fields (name, code, mimeType and primaryCategory) cannot be null or empty.

The body refers to the format of the request.

*   The body contains metadata about the content to be updated.
*   Please refer for supported [metadata](https://github.com/project-sunbird/knowledge-platform/blob/master/schemas/content/1.0/schema.json)

exec: pm.test("Verify keys and data type of the params in negative scenario", () => {
pm.test("Validate keys and data type of the response body", () => {
